Intermediate Terminal Exercises

Part I

  1. mkdir FIRST_NAME
    • export OREOFE=/Users/Me/FIRST_NAME
  2. echo $FIRST_NAME
  3. echo $PATH
  4. Path environment variable is used to find programs to execute
  5. I would want to create an environment variable to keep track of path to my project directory
  6. To permanently save environment variables, open the configuration file for your shell and save them there. i.e .bash_profile
  7. A process is a program that is being run on the computer
  8. To list all the processes running on your computer, use the command 'ps aux'
  9. A PID is number tha uniquely identifies a process
  10. To terminate a process, you use the command "kill or kill -9"
  11. Kill mostly kills a running process however, kill -9 is a non ignorable kill. Where a process has crashed, it will kill the crashed process also.
  12. For case insensitive search, you use grep flag -i
  13. grep flag -B allows for a certain number of lines before the match.
  14. grep flag -C allows for a certain number of lines around the match.
  15. grep flag -A allows for a certain number of lines after the match
  16. grep flag -w allows for a fill word search
  17. grep flag -n shows you the line number of a match

Part II

Write the following terminal commands to do the following (assume that instructors.txt is an imaginary file):

  1. find ~/Desktop -name "learn"
  2. find ~/Desktop -name "P*"
  3. find ~/Desktop -name "*.txt"
  4. find ~/Dsektop/views -name "*data*"
  5. grep -c "Elie" instructors.txt
  6. grep -w "P*" instructors.txt
  7. grep -ni "z*" instructors.txt
